drug.name: Triptolide
drug.description: Triptolide has been used in trials studying the treatment of HIV, Crohn's Disease, Intestinal Diseases, Gastrointestinal Diseases, and Digestive System Diseases, among others.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as oxepanes. These are compounds containing an oxepane ring, which is a seven-member saturated aliphatic heterocycle with one oxygen and six carbon atoms.

drug-interaction.name: Denosumab
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Denosumab is combined with Triptolide.

drug-interaction.name: Natalizumab
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Triptolide is combined with Natalizumab.

drug-interaction.name: Pimecrolimus
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Pimecrolimus is combined with Triptolide.

drug-interaction.name: Roflumilast
drug-interaction.description: Roflumilast may increase the immunosuppressive activities of Triptolide.

drug-interaction.name: Sipuleucel-T
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Sipuleucel-T can be decreased when used in combination with Triptolide.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Darbepoetin alfa is combined with Triptolide.

drug-interaction.name: Exenatide
drug-interaction.description: Exenatide can cause a decrease in the absorption of Triptolide resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.

drug-interaction.name: Thalidomide
